bibl.title: Letter from Lloyd D. LeMan to Philip Showalter Hench, February 23, 1942

div1.p: LeMan informs Hench that he has mailed the correct photograph and reiterates that the War Department has no photographs of Camp Lazear.

div1.head: Letter from Lloyd D. LeMan to Philip Showalter Hench, February 23, 1942
div1.opener:
IN REPLY
REFER TO
OCSigO 004.51
(2-23-42)
WAR DEPARTMENT
OFFICE OF THE CHIEF SIGNAL OFFICER
WASHINGTON
February 23, 1942.
A-5-S
Dr. Philip S. Hench,
Mayo Clinic,
Rochester, Minnesota.
Dear Sir:
div1.p:
Replying to your letter of February 10th, the Chief
Signal Officer directs me to advise that replacements have been
mailed to you of photographs numbered RB 1806 and RB 4094. It
is regretted that an error was made ordering these pictures.

The files have been rechecked, and there appears to
be no photograph in our files of Camp Lazear. There is no in-
formation available as to where such pictures could be found.
It is suggested that you inquire of the National Archives,
Washington, D. C.
div1.closer:
Yours very truly, Lloyd D. LeMan,
Major, Signal Corps.
